intro: Ranunculus bulbosus var. heterorrhiza, commonly known as the bulbous buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial native to North America. It features a bulbous root system and typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are usually hairy and have a heart-shaped base. Its flowers are bright yellow with five to seven petals and are borne on hairy stalks. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along streambanks.
